summary: This document is the extensive curriculum vitae of Dr. Elizabeth F. Loftus, a Distinguished Professor at the University of California, Irvine. It details her education, teaching experience, honors, awards, grants, publications, invited addresses, and professional activities. The document appears to be part of the Epstein case files, likely submitted as an exhibit (Exhibit A) to establish her credentials as an expert witness on human memory, particularly eyewitness testimony and false memories.

keyFacts: Dr. Elizabeth Loftus is a world-renowned expert on human memory, with a focus on its malleability, the misinformation effect, and the creation of false memories.
Her CV lists extensive consulting work for government agencies, including the U.S. Department of Justice, the FBI, the CIA, and the U.S. Secret Service, on matters related to memory and testimony.
She has served as an expert witness in legal cases in numerous U.S. states and internationally, applying psychological science to eyewitness testimony and claims of repressed memory.
Her research has been central to legal and societal debates about the reliability of eyewitness accounts and the validity of 'recovered' memories of trauma.
This document was filed as an exhibit (EFTA00073070, Exhibit A) in the Epstein case, presumably to qualify her as an expert witness on memory-related issues pertinent to the proceedings.
